Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Piscidin 2 (Pis-2; also named moronecidin, moro-NH2; WB piscidin 1, WB P1; natural AMPs; fish, animals; ZZP, UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: Mast cells, hybrid striped bass (Morone saxatilis x Morone chrysops)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: fish pathogens S. iniae (MIC 2.46 uM), L. garvieae (MIC 0.61 uM), V. anguillarum (MIC 4.91 uM), A-salmonicida (MIC >78.61 uM), human pathogens E. faecalis (MIC 1.23 uM), S. aureus (MIC 2.46 uM), S. flexneri (MIC 2.46 uM), and E. coli (MIC 4.91 uM). Its minimum parasiticidal concentrations (PC100 2.48 uM). It is also active against channel catfish virus (CCV) as well as frog virus 3 (FV3) (Chinchar VG et al. Virol. 323:268-275). It differs from piscidin 1 only at position 18 (R in piscidin 1 and K in piscidin 2). Thus, its structure is predicted to be helical, i.e. very similar to piscidin 1 (APD entry 473).  also named moronecidin, moro-NH2 (see ref AP2785). Updated 9/2014; Jan2017.
Literature Information.Author: Silphaduang U, Noga EJ2001
Literature Information.Title: Peptide antibiotics in mast cells of fish
